intro: Crucifera sophia, commonly known as the celestial mustard, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers that typically bloom in clusters. The plant produces long, slender pods that contain several seeds. Native to temperate regions, it thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
